description: Terms of A007634 where n-40 is not a square.
comments: Numbers n such that n^2 + n + 41 is composite and n - 40 is not a square. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 14 2014Note that if h(n) = n^2 + n + 41, and k(x) = x^2 + 40, then the composition of functions h(k(x)) has an algebraic factorization: h(k(x)) = (x^2 + 40)^2 + (x^2 + 40) + 41 = (x^2 + x + 41)*(x^2 - x + 41). Since both of the expressions in the above product are integers greater than 1, h(k(x)) is composite. - _Matt C. Anderson_, Oct 24 2012
links: Matt C. Anderson, A set of curves that cause n^2 + n + 41 to be composite
formula: a(n) ~ n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 14 2014
maple: A007634 := {}:for n from 0 to 1000 dok := n^2+n+41:if isprime(k) = false then A007634 := union(A007634, {n}) end if:end do:pv1 := Vector(1000, j -> (j-1)^2+40):p1 := convert(pv1, set):A055390 := minus(A007634, p1); # _Matt C. Anderson_, Sep 26 2011
crossrefs: Cf. A007634 (numbers where n^2 + n + 41 is composite). A194634 (numbers in A007634 that are not in 3 parabolas). - Matt C. Anderson, Sep 26 2011
author: _J. Lowell_, Oct 08 2000
